name: Mrs. Wordsmith
slogan: Helping young people to accelerate their vocabulary through visual learning
description:
Our mission is to show you the words. 

We want to connect every young person to the words they need to know, in the smartest and most unforgettable way, so they can enjoy the journey and avoid cramming.
 
About us 
 
Mrs Wordsmith is one of the fastest growing startups in the UK, used and loved by teachers, parents and students. 
 
The team is made up of engineers, designers, linguists and educators from around the world, with deep backgrounds in public and private schools, as well as from Cambridge University's leading Natural Language Processing group, Criteo, Oxford University Press, Peak Labs and more.

Launched in 2016 and based in London, United Kingdom, Mrs Wordsmith is a subscription service that helps young people accelerate their vocabulary through visual learning. The words students encounter on the 10,000 Word Journey are illustrated by the award winning artists behind Madagascar and Hotel Transylvania.

jobs.title: Community Manager (China)
jobs.description:
About us

Mrs Wordsmith is on a mission to revolutionise education and make kids fall in love with learning by bringing world class animation and gaming talent to the sector.

We are building a 3D interactive and animated world for Generation Alpha. Children aged 4-10 can navigate the world designed by our Hollywood artists and accelerate their vocabulary. Combining this with our beautifully illustrated, data-driven educational print products, Mrs Wordsmith is on an exciting journey to revolutionise education and make kids from London to Beijing fall in love with learning. This is vocabulary building that works.

The company is venture backed by leading UK, US and Chinese investors. We recently raised an $11.5 million round of Series A funding and have been named as one of the Top 100 London Startups to Watch in 2019 by SeedTable.

Requirements

About the role

We are looking for a talented and creative Community Manager to help build and grow an engaged and active Mrs Wordsmith community in China as we launch a first of its kind educational English language learning app and a supporting catalogue of print products into China. You will represent Mrs Wordsmith in online forums and social platforms and interact with a growing community of parents, children and teachers as we build our presence. You will be responsible for bringing the values of Mrs Wordsmith to a Chinese audience and to build a community as engaged and passionate about our mission as we are. In order to do this, you will be responsible for creating content for social platforms such as WeChat and Weibo, you will preempt concerns and trends within our user-base, you will respond to customer queries and issues and you will work hard to delight and surprise our customers across all areas of their experience with our digital and print products.

As Community Manager, you will regularly be required to:

* Work with our Digital team in the UK and China to build an engaging and proactive online community for our digital apps and print products
* Be the voice of Mrs Wordsmith for our customers in China by building positive relationships across our community, providing support across our digital products and creating engaging content on social platforms such as WeChat and Weibo
* Liaise with our Marketing team in the UK to represent our Chinese customers in terms of app development, customer satisfaction, operational decision-making and local trends
* Develop strategies for expanding our community and encouraging word-of-mouth growth

This role is perfect for someone who has extensive experience building communities around world-class apps. You will use your excellent written skills to engage and delight our customers and your professional, hard-working, hands-on attitude will help you thrive in this exciting role. This is a new role for Mrs Wordsmith and as such will initially be a fully-remote role.



About you

* Native-level Chinese language skills and excellent written and spoken English
* Previous experience in community management within major games, either with a studio or publisher
* Practical experience building large-scale and self-sustaining communities in China
* Proven experience creating engaging content and building strong relationships on social platforms like WeChat and Weibo, with an interest in keeping up to date with other useful platforms
* Self-starter with an ability to adapt to changing landscapes and an ability to react to trends within our community
* Passionate about apps, games and the online communities surrounding them
* Passionate about our mission of helping children across the globe improve their vocabulary and learning potential

Benefits

Why work with us

* Make an impact on the future of education
* A wildly diverse team that celebrates our differences
* We are a well-funded, high-growth rocket-ship on a mission
* Competitive salary
* Access to an amazing network of mentors, advisors and talented colleagues
* Immerse yourself in language, words, data and creativity

Our values

We are looking for someone who will thrive in a company that values:

* The power of words to change lives
* Diversity of background and thought, underpinning a shared vision
* Community-focus: students, teachers and parents are at the heart of everything we do
* The magic that happens when data meets creativity
* Pushing the boundaries and taking risks

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Experienced Unity Developer - Mobile Games
jobs.description:
About us

Mrs Wordsmith is on a mission to revolutionise education and make kids fall in love with learning by bringing world class animation and gaming talent to the sector.

We are building a 3D interactive and animated game world Generation Alpha. Children aged 4-10 can navigate the world designed by our Hollywood artists and accelerate their vocabulary. You will have the opportunity to also work with a team of games developers and technical artists from Natural Motion, Mindshapes, Marco Polo and beyond.

The company is venture backed by leading UK, US and Chinese investors. We recently raised an $11.5 million round of funding.funding.

About the role

As a Unity Developer at Mrs Wordsmith, you will work as part of a team of highly talented and innovative app developers and designers building an industry-defining 3D mobile game (iOs and Android) with a simple mission: to teach children the words they need to succeed. Building on the work of our world-class machine learning and curriculum teams, our apps bring learning to life through hilariously illustrated words and interactive animations featuring our band of engaging characters.

At Mrs Wordsmith, we believe in the magic that happens when data and creativity meet. As a result, our approach to learning is deeply rooted in research and pedagogy but is reliant on our hilarious illustrations and animations. Through your work developing our apps, you will be responsible for bringing these two sides together in a consumer product that not only engages children in learning but delights them and introduces them to the Mrs Wordsmith world.


Salary £40,000-80,000 depending on level of experience

MUST BE BASED IN LONDON


Our app developers are highly knowledgeable and resourceful in their approach to problem solving. You will regularly be required to:

* Work closely with our VP Digital, app team and creative teams to turn product specifications and design prototypes into fully functional mobile applications
* Contribute development ideas to the team, prototyping and iterating until all stakeholders (including the CEO) are happy with the results
* Collaborate with the rest of the app and design team to produce world-class products
* Work independently to tight development deadlines to deliver new features and functionality to new and existing applications
* Present your work and your ideas to the rest of your team and, where you're comfortable doing so, the rest of the company to let everyone know about the exciting things you're working on


This role is perfect for a full time mobile app developer with good experience working in games using Unity (C#) and has great experience with native iOS (Swift) and/or Android (Java). We are looking for someone to join the team on a full-time basis working in our newly renovated, spacious warehouse office in Clerkenwell, London.


Requirements

About you

* Mobile app development experience using Unity (C#) plus native iOS (Swift) and/or Android (Java)
* Previous experience working in the games industry or with games applications
* An impressive portfolio of work that demonstrates a strong grasp of mobile app development
* Resilient and able to quickly iterate over ideas to get the best outcome for the product

* Excellent planning and organisational skills
* Ability to work fast, under tight production deadlines
* Enthusiastic about the challenge of bringing learning to life

This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a games background to help build applications that will revolutionise the way in which children across the world learn. We love to hear from people with diverse backgrounds so if you have read through this advert and think you could make a real difference on this team, please get in touch!

Benefits

Why work with us

* Salary 40,000-80,000 depending on experience
* Make an impact on the future of learning
* A diverse team that celebrates our differences
* A playful, creative, working environment complete with dogs and a collaborative Sonos playlist
* We are a well-funded, high-growth rocket-ship on a mission
* Access to an amazing network of mentors, advisors and talented colleagues
* Meaningful equity
* Immerse yourself in language, words, data and creativity
* Ever-growing weekly shop with tons of healthy food and sweet treats
* Amazing coffee and a wide selection of herbal teas

Our values

We are looking for someone who will thrive in a company that values:

* The power of words to change lives
* Diversity of background and thought, underpinning a shared vision
* Community-focus: students, teachers and parents are at the heart of everything we do
* The magic that happens when data meets creativity
* Pushing the boundaries and taking risks


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Finance & Operations Assistant
jobs.description:
About us

Mrs Wordsmith is on a mission to revolutionise education and make kids fall in love with learning by bringing world class animation and gaming talent to the sector.

We are building a 3D interactive and animated game world Generation Alpha. Children aged 4-10 can navigate the world designed by our Hollywood artists and accelerate their vocabulary. You will have the opportunity to also work with a team of ML engineers from Cambridge and Benevolent AI to develop a word game engine that will enable us to pump out more exciting apps for all age groups.

The company is venture backed by leading UK, US and Chinese investors. We recently raised an $11.5 million round of funding.

About the role

We are looking for an enthusiastic, highly organised Finance & Operations Assistant to help support our Finance and Ops team as we build towards the launch of our upcoming mobile app and catalogue of new print products. You will assist our Finance Controller with a wide variety of finance tasks - from month end reconciliations to payroll - as well as providing ongoing support with HR admin across recruitment, compliance and ownership of our contracts.

Reporting directly to our Finance Director, you will work on a wide variety of processes that underpin our high-growth business, such as:

Accounts Payable

* Set up new supplier details and payment terms correctly on the system and ensure that the new account procedures are adhered in accordance with policy
* Process invoices promptly and accurately through ReceiptBank, ensuring they are approved /an or matched to a valid PO
* Reconcile supplier accounts on a monthly basis, prior to any payments made

Accounts Receivable

* Raise external invoices / credit notes via Xero
* Undertake the sales ledger administration procedure
* Work with the Customer Operations team regarding overdue invoices
* Review blocked orders, reporting and correcting any errors

Print Operations

* Work with our print production team to ensure smooth running of our print operations
* Gather quotes from printers and distributors and work with the Finance and Ops team to establish cost effectiveness

People Operations

* Assist with the end-to-end recruitment process, from writing job specs (like this!) to applicant screening, interview scheduling and letting candidates know our decision
* Be the point of contact for HR admin including absence management (using CharlieHR), communicating policies to the team and managing our visa sponsorship
* Make sure that all existing and new employees have the tech and equipment they need to do their best work

Finance Operations

* Ensure up-to-date book-keeping
* Prepare weekly payment runs.
* Uploading bank statements and PayPal statements to Xero
* Credit card / Charge card reconciliations

Requirements

About you

* Degree educated
* Highly numerate with an ability to bring an analytical mindset to operational processes
* Very comfortable working with Excel and able to pick up other technologies as you go
* Highly organised and able to manage your own time based on the projects you have
* Flexible and wish to understand and work across all areas of the business
* Previous experience with Xero is a huge plus
* Previous experience with recruitment and some understanding of UK employment law would be advantageous
* Empathetic and able to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion

Benefits

Why work with us

* Make an impact on the future of education
* A wildly diverse team that celebrates our differences
* A playful, creative, working environment complete with dogs and a collaborative Sonos playlist
* Work in a newly renovated warehouse-style office in Clerkenwell
* We are a well-funded, high-growth rocket-ship on a mission
* Access to an amazing network of mentors, advisors and talented colleagues
* Immerse yourself in language, words, data and creativity
* An ever-growing weekly shop with tons of healthy food and sweet treats plus great coffee

Our values

We are looking for someone who will thrive in a company that values:

* The power of words to change lives
* Diversity of background and thought, underpinning a shared vision
* Community-focus: students, teachers and parents are at the heart of everything we do
* The magic that happens when data meets creativity
* Pushing the boundaries and taking risks

jobs.title: Finance Manager
jobs.description:
About us

Mrs Wordsmith is on a mission to revolutionise education and make kids fall in love with learning.

We are building a world class, animated word game engine that will enable it to re-imagine the dictionary and produce word learning games. Our first app is going to launch early next year and is a first-of-its-kind animated game for kids aged 3-6, designed to accelerate their vocabulary and introduce them to a new world of learning.

Combining this with our beautifully illustrated, data-driven educational print products - from our social and narrative journeys to our ‘Word Sauce!’ storytellers dictionary and beyond - Mrs Wordsmith is on an exciting journey to revolutionise education and make kids from London to Beijing fall in love with learning. This is vocabulary building that works.

The company is venture backed by leading UK, US and Chinese investors. We recently raised an $11.5 million round of funding.


About the role

We are looking for a talented, highly organised Financial Business Manager to take full control of our end-to-end financial processes - from accounts payable to financial analysis and business partnering - and help us maintain efficiency across our financial tools, including Xero.


You will report directly to our Finance Director and you will be required to:

* Build and maintain financial models & cash flow forecasts on an on-going basis
* Business partner across Marketing, Tech and Operations to provide the teams with the analytical horsepower to make data-driven decisions
* Manage relations with tax advisors on grants, option scheme and other tax related matters
* Ensure up-to-date book-keeping
* Manage AP & AR
* Prepare monthly management accounts, including accruals, prepayments and fixed assets along with creation and loading of journals
* Undertake monthly balance sheet reconciliations
* Work closely with our external accountants to complete Payroll and statutory reporting

This role is perfect for someone who is a part- or newly-qualified accountant looking for an opportunity to get under the skin of an exciting, innovative and fast-paced startup that is revolutionising education on a mission to make every kid in the world - big or small, from London to Beijing - laugh while they learn.

Requirements

About you

* Qualified accountant
* First class excel and modelling skills
* Extremely hands on with a ‘roll your sleeves up and get your hands dirty’ mentality
* Previous experience with Xero is a huge plus
* Startup enthusiast
* Dependable, analytical and highly organised
* Flexible and wish to understand and become a part of the whole business - not just the numbers

Benefits

Why work with us

* Make an impact on the future of education
* A wildly diverse team that celebrates our differences
* A playful, creative, working environment complete with dogs and a collaborative Sonos playlist
* Work in a newly renovated warehouse-style office in Clerkenwell
* We are a well-funded, high-growth rocket-ship on a mission
* Access to an amazing network of mentors, advisors and talented colleagues
* Immerse yourself in language, words, data and creativity
* An ever-growing weekly shop with tons of healthy food and sweet treats plus great coffee

Our values

* We are looking for someone who will thrive in a company that values:
* The power of words to change lives
* Diversity of background and thought, underpinning a shared vision
* Community-focus: students, teachers and parents are at the heart of everything we do
* The magic that happens when data meets creativity
* Pushing the boundaries and taking risks

Closing date: Upon Filling the Role

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Games Designer
jobs.description:
About us

Mrs Wordsmith is on a mission to revolutionise education and make kids fall in love with learning by bringing world class animation and gaming talent to the sector.

We are building a 3D interactive and animated game world Generation Alpha. Children aged 4-10 can navigate the world designed by our Hollywood artists and accelerate their vocabulary. You will have the opportunity to also work with a team of ML engineers from Cambridge and Benevolent AI to develop a word game engine that will enable us to pump out more exciting apps for all age groups.

The company is venture backed by leading UK, US and Chinese investors.


About the role

We’re looking for a talented Game Designer to join our growing digital team working on our animated and interactive game designed to help children across the globe accelerate their vocabulary. You will use your detailed understanding of gameplay loops to create a balanced and high performing user experience.

You’ll be working on an educational game which will require designs on mini-games, core gameplay action, flow and general UX/UI moments to connect the experience together. You will also be aware of every other system in the game and how they impact and connect to your area of ownership.

You will be able to work collaboratively across the team to ensure the best possible ideas are stress- tested and realised in-game. Ultimately - your intuition, borne out of experience, will help guide a project from conception to release and beyond.

Responsibilities

* Work closely with our dev teams to ensure the correct implementation of design
* Review and evolve the game economy to achieve commercial goals
* Playtest, balance, and provide feedback on new game systems

Requirements

* Strong understanding of gameplay with a bias in the genre of Action and Adventure. Also have experience or excellent ideas for mini-games.
* To be able to take direction from the Creative Director and then flesh out into the game.
* Experience with at least 1 released game.
* Excellent communication and team working skills.
* A strong passion for games, and joyful experiences.

It would also be great if you have:

* Art capabilities in order to draw out / storyboard your ideas for the team.

Benefits

* Make an impact on the future of education
* A wildly diverse team that celebrates our differences

jobs.title: Games UI/UX Designer & Artist
jobs.description:
About us

Mrs Wordsmith is on a mission to revolutionise education and make kids fall in love with learning by bringing world class animation and gaming talent to the sector.

We are building a 3D interactive and animated game world Generation Alpha. Children aged 4-10 can navigate the world designed by our Hollywood artists and accelerate their vocabulary. You will have the opportunity to also work with a team of ML engineers from Cambridge and Benevolent AI to develop a word game engine that will enable us to pump out more exciting apps for all age groups.

The company is venture backed by leading UK, US and Chinese investors.

About the role

We are looking for a Games UI/UX Designer & Artist to join the growing Art team in London help us succeed in our current and future challenges.

You are a Games UI/UX Designer & Artist with at least 2 years of experience developing video games. You are extremely proficient with Unity, passionate for games and would like to help us take the team to the next level.

Responsibilities

* With an excellent understanding of UI and UX, produce designs for the current game in development.
* Can also create high quality UI assets for use on our mobile/tablet products
* Collaborate on the full game development lifecycle from design, planning, implementation from an art perspective
* Pick up existing projects and contribute to asset creation in the style as directed by the Art Director

Requirements

* At least 2 years of video game development experience.
* Comprehensive portfolio showing wonderful examples of your craft.
* Extreme proficiency with Unity.
* UI (and some UX) Design and implementation skills.
* Ability to render UI elements in a bright, casual game mainstream style.
* Excellent communication skills

It would also be great if you have:

* A clear understanding of the particular challenges in game development, such as art workflow, performance optimisations, and supporting multiple platforms.
* Experience on multiple games and ability to work across varied art styles.
* Experience in following and guiding others on best practices, suggesting and maintaining pipelines, re-use, and optimisations.
* Experience in planning and estimating/scheduling.
